Social Cognition Center Cologne,University of Cologne,50931 Cologne,Germany.simone.dohle@uni-koeln.dewilhelm.hofmann@uni-koeln.dehttp://soccco.uni-koeln.de/simone-dohle.htmlhttp://soccco.uni-koeln.de/wilhelm-hofmann.html.
text: Nettle et al. provide a useful but incomplete analysis of the drivers of obesity. In this commentary, we argue that a dual-motives conceptualization of self-control, together with insights from the psychology of (perceived and actual) scarcity, might help advance a more fine-grained mechanistic understanding of the observed association between food insecurity and obesity.
title: Toward a mechanistic understanding of the impact of food insecurity on obesity.
